Description: Reported fishing gear type used in the fishery
Low Risk (Target Reference Point): No Destructive fishing practices being used
Purpose: Evaluates if destructive fishing gear are used

Description: Number of registered fishers and buyers reporting catch
Purpose: Adequate reporting effort by fishers and buyers may be used to determine changes in fishing season and fishing effort

Description: Number of target species that appear in the catch
Purpose: Changes in species composition may be used to evaluate fisheries performance, change in environmental  and market conditions

Description: Vulnerability of target species to to fishing (0 - 100). Higher values indicate higher vulnerability
Purpose: Assess relative vulnerability of target species to fishing

Description: Ratio between fished and unfished biomass for the enire fish assemblages.
Purpose: Provides an estimate of ecosystem status and capacity to support fishing

Description: Average length of individuals in the catch
Purpose: Assess changes in the status of a fishery to smaller or larger individuals

Description: Average trophic level of species in the catch. Higher values towards 5 indicate carnivores, lower values towards 2 indicate herbivores
Purpose: Assess changes in the status of a fishery to lower  or higher trophic groups

Description: Proportion of mature individuals in the catch
Purpose: Evaluates the status of the stock regarding mature individuals

Description: Proportion of optimal size individuals in the catch to maximize production and profit
Purpose: Evaluates the status of the stock regarding optimal catch to evaluate production and profit

Description: Proportion of the catch that are megaspawners (large and older individuals that produce lots of eggs)
Purpose: Evaluates the reproductive capacity of fish populations

Description: Proportion of the unfished reproductive potential left in a fish population under fishing pressure
Purpose: Estimates current egg production relative to maximum possible production at unfished levels.

Description: Proportion of the unfished reproductive potential left in an invertebrate population under fishing pressure
Purpose: Estimates current egg production relative to maximum possible production at unfished levels.

Description: Catch Per Unit of Effort (CPUE) is the total catch per fishing effort (e.g., number of trips, fishing hours, gear type)
Purpose: It can be used to Infer population trends of exploited stock. Standarized time series of CPUE can be used as index of abundance.

Description: Total catch recorded for a given area
Purpose: It can provide an estimate of total abundance when sampling is stratified.
